content:
hey @WG-polonius :)
I personally won't have a lot of time with the end-of-year rush (+ holiday vacations) so what do you think about having async updates here instead of sync meetings for the next few weeks (2 to 3) ?
(I'll have more time towards the end of December through the 1st week of January, but not necessarily a fixed schedule)

• this week I have been slowly working on improving the datafrog generator so we (or Vytautas) can use actually start using it (with the renamed / updated rules / souffl√©'s ";" syntax for alternatives)
  • I hope to keep working on this to fix the bugs (hopefully until the new year), and add these couple features, and also try it out on the couple datalog papers Frank mentioned in their latest post (I've already started doing this, and it surfaced some bugs, they don't impact our rules usage, but still)

and Niko if you want to use the sync meeting time, a couple interesting things could be:

  • Albin's WIP PR about move errors could use some reviewing (the WIP-ness is mostly related to lack of unit tests, if I understand correctly): polonius#135
  • not strictly related but I'm sure Matthew would love it if we can finally land #65232: replacing the leak-check with universes :)

Regarding leak-check, yes, I've been thinking about it, which is partly why I've been pursuing the chalk changes I have been, because they actually lead to a potentially slightly different place than that PR, and I wanted to see if they made sense and try to figure out what that might mean for rustc
It's taking longer than I thought so maybe I should re-order some of that thinking, though
(In fact, maybe @Matthew Jasper and I could spend some time talking it out, would be really useful to have someone to discuss it with)
We could. Would the meeting today be a good time, or should we try to find another time?
Hmm today's meeting could maybe work, yeah @Matthew Jasper
Hey @Matthew Jasper -- maybe we should chat in #wg-traits ?
But this seems a bit more general than polonius :)
